page.title: 07Blinds at Clanfield Mill
page.content: At the Mill at Little Clanfield there is a small company that makes and fits window blinds. The owner works thirteen hours a day and he employs ten people who work eight hours a day each. It takes on about half an hour to make a roller blind.He also makes vertical blinds and shop window canopies. They use saws, cutting tables ,sharp knives and sewing machines to make them. In the first six months of 1985 they used over five hundred metres of material.Cotton, wood and aluminium are used in the construction of the blinds.The only accidents in the factory in the first six months of 1985 have been burnt fingers and a bad back. The blinds are advertised in the local press and by a mobile trailer at local events.Two vans and a car are used to deliver the blinds which are then fitted by one of the staff.
